exec: pm.test("Status code is 200 or 400", function () {    //pm.response.to.have.status(200);    pm.expect(pm.response.code).to.be.oneOf([200,400]);});pm.test("Reponse Body is JSON", function () {    pm.response.to.have.header("Content-Type");    pm.expect(pm.response.headers.get("Content-Type")).to.include("application/json");});pm.test("Login Successful", function () {    var json = JSON.parse(responseBody);    if (pm.response.code == 400 ) {        console.error("Error: " + json.error + " Message: " + json.error_description)    }    pm.expect(pm.response.text()).to.include("access_token");        var currentDate = Date.now();    var expires = (json.expires_in * 1000);    var expirationDate = new Date(  currentDate  + expires ) ;    console.info("Current Date: " + new Date(currentDate).toLocaleString() + " Expiration Date: " + expirationDate.toLocaleString());    // DO NOT GET THE TOKEN FROM THE POST - USE THE "Get Token" BUTTON IN POSTMAN TO GET THE TOKEN    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("bearerToken", json.access_token);    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("bearerToken-expirationDate", expirationDate);});// This may appear "Per request to stop further test runs"if (pm.response.code != 200 ) {    postman.setNextRequest(null);    return;}

exec: pm.test("Status code is 200 or 400", function () {    //pm.response.to.have.status(200);    pm.expect(pm.response.code).to.be.oneOf([200,400]);});pm.test("Reponse Body is JSON", function () {    pm.response.to.have.header("Content-Type");    pm.expect(pm.response.headers.get("Content-Type")).to.include("application/json");});pm.test("Login Successful", function () {    var json = JSON.parse(responseBody);    if (pm.response.code == 400 ) {        console.error("Error: " + json.error + " Message: " + json.error_description)    }    pm.expect(pm.response.text()).to.include("access_token");        var currentDate = Date.now();    var expires = (json.expires_in * 1000);    var expirationDate = new Date(  currentDate  + expires ) ;    console.info("Current Date: " + new Date(currentDate).toLocaleString() + " Expiration Date: " + expirationDate.toLocaleString());    // DO NOT GET THE TOKEN FROM THE POST - USE THE "Get Token" BUTTON IN POSTMAN TO GET THE TOKEN    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("bearerToken", json.access_token);    postman.setEnvironmentVariable("bearerToken-expirationDate", expirationDate);});// This may appear "Per request to stop further test runs"if (pm.response.code != 200 ) {    postman.setNextRequest(null);    return;}
